CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

1. J sc and FF are not material names, but rather measurements related to the performance of the device.
2. PIDT-C12NT is a material name, as it is a specific type of polymer used in the device.
3. The other two polymers are also material names, but the specific names are not provided in the paragraph.
4. PIDT - EHNT, PIDT - DTNT, and PC71BM are also material names.
5. Indacenodithiophene (IDT) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT) are material names, as they are the building blocks used to synthesize the polymers.
6. The branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain, linear hexyl side chain, and bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain are not material names, but rather descriptions of the chemical structure of the polymers.

Therefore, the material names in the paragraph are:

* PIDT-C12NT
* The other two polymers
* PIDT - EHNT
* PIDT - DTNT
* PC71BM
* Indacenodithiophene (IDT)
* Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

* PIDT-C12NT
* The other two polymers (although the specific names are not provided, they are still material names in this context)
* PIDT - EHNT
* PIDT - DTNT
* PC71BM
* Indacenodithiophene (IDT)
* Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| The other two polymers |
| PIDT - EHNT |
| PIDT - DTNT |
| PC71BM |
| Indacenodithiophene (IDT) |
| Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT) |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

1. J sc: Short circuit current density
2. FF: Fill factor
3. Morphology: The physical shape and structure of the photoactive layer
4. Domain size: The size of the crystalline or ordered regions in the photoactive layer
5. Charge carrier mobility: The speed at which charge carriers (electrons and holes) can move through the material
6. Exciton separation: The process of separating bound electron-hole pairs (excitons) into free charges
7. Film absorption coefficient: A measure of how strongly a material absorbs light
8. External quantum efficiency (EQEs): The ratio of the number of charge carriers collected by a solar cell to the number of photons incident on the cell
9. Current density: The amount of electrical current flowing through a unit area
10. HOMO levels: The highest occupied molecular orbital levels in the donor polymers, which determine the open-circuit voltage of the solar cell devices.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. J sc: Short circuit current density
2. Charge carrier mobility
3. Exciton separation
4. Film absorption coefficient
5. EQEs (External Quantum Efficiency)
6. Current density
7. HOMO levels.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| J sc (Short circuit current density) |
| Charge carrier mobility |
| Exciton separation |
| Film absorption coefficient |
| EQEs (External Quantum Efficiency) |
| Current density |
| HOMO levels |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

1. "J sc of PIDT-C12NT was 9.72 mA cm^-2" (mA refers to milliamperes and cm^-2 is the unit for current density, so the value is 9.72 mA/cm^2 or 9.72 milliamperes per square centimeter).
2. "The film absorption coefficient of PIDT-C12NT was enhanced" (The unit for absorption coefficient is not specified in the paragraph, so no numerical value can be identified here).
3. "The accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light" (EQEs refers to external quantum efficiency, but the numerical value is not provided in the paragraph).
4. "The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18, 7.83, and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT, PIDT - DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT respectively" (The values are 4.18, 7.83, and 9.72 mA/cm^2 or milliamperes per square centimeter).
5. "The open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices was high" (The unit for open circuit voltage is not specified in the paragraph, so no numerical value can be identified here).

Note: The other properties mentioned in the paragraph, such as "optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer" and "superior charge carrier mobility" do not have specific numerical values associated with them.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. "J sc of PIDT-C12NT was 9.72 mA cm^-2" (9.72 mA/cm^2 or milliamperes per square centimeter)
2. "The film absorption coefficient of PIDT-C12NT was enhanced" (No numerical value provided)
3. "The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18, 7.83, and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT, PIDT - DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT respectively" (4.18, 7.83, and 9.72 mA/cm^2 or milliamperes per square centimeter)
4. "The open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices was high" (No numerical value provided)

Note: The other properties mentioned in the paragraph, such as "optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer" and "superior charge carrier mobility" do not have specific numerical values associated with them, so they have been removed.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J sc of PIDT-C12NT was 9.72 mA cm^-2 |
| The film absorption coefficient of PIDT-C12NT was enhanced |
| The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18, 7.83, and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT, PIDT - DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT respectively |
| The open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices was high |

Note: The first and third rows have numerical values associated with them, while the second and fourth rows do not have specific numerical values.
